intro: Melampyrum setaceum, commonly known as the slender touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and sessile, often appearing in pairs along the stem. The species is known for its ability to grow in a variety of soil types, including poor and disturbed sites.
